title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Proverbs chapter 20 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Proverbs Chapter 20.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 20:1, what is wine described as?
questions.correctAnswer: A mocker
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:1 states that 'Wine is a mocker.'

questions.question: What is compared to the roaring of a lion in Proverbs 20:2?
questions.correctAnswer: The fear of a king
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:2 says, 'The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion.'

questions.question: What does Proverbs 20:3 say is an honour for a man?
questions.correctAnswer: To cease from strife
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:3 states, 'It is an honour for a man to cease from strife.'

questions.question: Who will beg in harvest and have nothing, according to Proverbs 20:4?
questions.correctAnswer: The sluggard
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:4 says, 'The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 20:5, what is counsel in the heart of man compared to?
questions.correctAnswer: Deep water
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:5 states, 'Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water.'

questions.question: What does Proverbs 20:6 say most men will proclaim?
questions.correctAnswer: Their own goodness
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:6 says, 'Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 20:7 states that the just man walks in his integrity and his children are blessed after him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:7 says, 'The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.'

questions.question: What does a king do with his eyes, according to Proverbs 20:8?
questions.correctAnswer: Scatter away all evil
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:8 states, 'A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 20:10, what are an abomination to the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Divers weights and divers measures
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:10 says, 'Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them are alike abomination to the LORD.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 20:12 teaches that the hearing ear and the seeing eye are made by the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:12 states, 'The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.'

questions.question: What does Proverbs 20:13 warn against loving?
questions.correctAnswer: Sleep
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:13 says, 'Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty.'

questions.question: Complete the verse from Proverbs 20:15: 'There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but the lips of ______ are a precious jewel.'
questions.correctAnswer: knowledge
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:15 says, 'The lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.'

questions.question: Who does Proverbs 20:19 warn against meddling with?
options: Him that flattereth with his lips
questions.correctAnswer: Him that flattereth with his lips
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:19 says, 'Therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 20:22 advises to repay evil quickly.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:22 says, 'Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the LORD, and he shall save thee.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 20:29, what is the glory of young men?
questions.correctAnswer: Their strength
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:29 states, 'The glory of young men is their strength.'

medium.title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Proverbs Chapter 20 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with controlling their anger and wants to understand the consequences of provoking authority. Based on Proverbs 20, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Provoking a king is like provoking a roaring lion and harms oneself
It is wise to challenge authority often
questions.correctAnswer: Provoking a king is like provoking a roaring lion and harms oneself
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:2 teaches that the fear of a king is like the roaring of a lion, and provoking him to anger is sinning against one's own soul. This highlights the serious consequences of anger against authority.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 20 teach about the value of integrity in family life?
options: A just man walking in integrity blesses his children
Family blessings come from wealth, not integrity
Integrity is less important than social status
questions.correctAnswer: A just man walking in integrity blesses his children
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:7 states that the just man walks in integrity and his children are blessed after him, teaching that personal righteousness positively impacts family legacy.

questions.question: What practical advice does Proverbs 20 give regarding work ethic?
options: The sluggard will beg during harvest due to laziness
Work hard only when you feel like it
Cold weather is a good excuse to avoid work
Resting more leads to greater blessings
questions.correctAnswer: The sluggard will beg during harvest due to laziness
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:4 warns that the sluggard does not plow because of cold and ends up begging during harvest, highlighting the consequences of laziness and the importance of diligence.

questions.question: A believer is tempted by deceitful gain. What wisdom does Proverbs 20 offer about dishonest bread?
options: Bread of deceit is sweet at first but leaves bitterness later
Deceitful gain leads to lasting happiness
Dishonesty is acceptable if it benefits you
questions.correctAnswer: Bread of deceit is sweet at first but leaves bitterness later
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:17 teaches that bread gained by deceit is sweet to a man, but his mouth will be filled with gravel later, warning against dishonest gain and its consequences.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 20 highlight the importance of wise counsel in decision making?
options: Every purpose is established by counsel and good advice
Counsel is unnecessary for wise people
Decisions made alone are always best
War should be waged without advice
questions.correctAnswer: Every purpose is established by counsel and good advice
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:18 emphasizes that plans succeed through counsel and that good advice is vital, especially when making significant decisions like going to war.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 20 teach about honesty in business dealings?
options: Diverse weights and measures are an abomination to the LORD
Cheating in trade is acceptable if profitable
False balances are a good way to gain advantage
questions.correctAnswer: Diverse weights and measures are an abomination to the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:10 and 20:23 both declare that using dishonest weights and measures is detestable to God, highlighting the biblical call for honesty in business.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 20 encourage believers to deal with revenge and evil?
options: Do not repay evil; wait on the LORD for salvation
Eye for an eye is the best approach
questions.correctAnswer: Do not repay evil; wait on the LORD for salvation
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:22 advises believers to not seek revenge but to wait on the LORD who will save, teaching trust in God's justice and patience.

questions.question: What role does mercy play in leadership according to Proverbs 20?
options: Mercy and truth preserve the king and uphold his throne
Leaders should be harsh without mercy
Truth alone is enough without mercy
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy and truth preserve the king and uphold his throne
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:28 explains that both mercy and truth protect the king and sustain his reign, highlighting the importance of compassionate leadership.

questions.question: A believer wants to understand the value of knowledge. What does Proverbs 20 say about the lips of knowledge?
options: The lips of knowledge are a precious jewel
Knowledge is less valuable than gold
Words do not matter as much as actions
questions.correctAnswer: The lips of knowledge are a precious jewel
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:15 describes the lips of knowledge as more valuable than gold and rubies, emphasizing the high worth of wise and knowledgeable speech.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 20 teaches that even children are known by their actions and work.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:11 states that even a child is known by his doings, whether his work is pure and right, showing that actions reveal character at any age.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 20 instruct believers about the dangers of sleep and laziness?
options: Love not sleep, lest poverty come; be diligent and you will be satisfied
Sleep is the best remedy for poverty
Sleeping more is a sign of wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Love not sleep, lest poverty come; be diligent and you will be satisfied
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:13 warns against loving sleep because it can lead to poverty, encouraging vigilance and diligence to have enough bread.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 20 teach about the human heart and sin?
options: No one can claim their heart is completely clean and free from sin
Everyone can be perfect without sin
Sin is easy to avoid in the heart
The heart is irrelevant to righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: No one can claim their heart is completely clean and free from sin
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:9 asks who can say, 'I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin,' indicating that all humans struggle with sin and need God's grace.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to spread gossip. What biblical warning does Proverbs 20 give about this behavior?
options: Talebearers reveal secrets and should be avoided
Gossip is harmless and builds community
It is wise to share all secrets
questions.correctAnswer: Talebearers reveal secrets and should be avoided
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:19 warns that one who goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets, advising believers not to associate with such flatterers, promoting discretion and peace.

questions.question: True or False: According to Proverbs 20, a wise king scatters the wicked and brings destruction upon them.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:26 states that a wise king scatters the wicked and brings the wheel over them, illustrating that wise leadership involves justice and removing evil.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The spirit of man is the _______ of the LORD, searching all the inward parts of the belly.'
questions.correctAnswer: candle
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:27 says the spirit of man is the candle of the LORD, meaning God’s light searches a person’s innermost being, showing His knowledge and guidance.

hard.title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Proverbs Chapter 20.

questions.question: In Proverbs 20:1, wine is described as a mocker and strong drink as raging. Which Old Testament book also warns about the dangers of strong drink leading to loss of self-control?
questions.correctAnswer: Ecclesiastes
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 10:17 warns about wine leading to mockery and strong drink causing brawling, paralleling Proverbs 20:1's caution against deception through alcohol.

questions.question: Proverbs 20:5 likens counsel in the heart of man to deep water. What Hebrew literary device is primarily used in this verse?
questions.correctAnswer: Simile
questions.explanation: The phrase 'like deep water' is a simile comparing hidden counsel to deep water, emphasizing its depth and need to be drawn out, as seen in Proverbs 20:5.

questions.question: Which theme prevalent in Proverbs 20:7, about a just man walking in integrity, is also emphasized in the New Testament epistles?
questions.correctAnswer: Integrity and righteousness
questions.explanation: Integrity and righteousness as marks of the just man in Proverbs 20:7 align with New Testament teachings on living a righteous life, such as in James 2:14-26 emphasizing faith evidenced by works.

questions.question: Proverbs 20:10 condemns 'divers weights and divers measures.' What was the historical significance of this practice in the ancient Near East?
options: It was a common method of trade fraud
questions.correctAnswer: It was a common method of trade fraud
questions.explanation: Using false weights and measures was a widespread form of cheating in commerce in the ancient Near East, making it an abomination to the LORD as stated in Proverbs 20:10.

questions.question: In Proverbs 20:12, the hearing ear and seeing eye are said to be made by the LORD. How does this verse reflect the theological concept of divine sovereignty?
options: It shows God’s control over human faculties
It refers only to sensory organs
questions.correctAnswer: It shows God’s control over human faculties
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:12 emphasizes that God is the creator of human senses, underscoring divine sovereignty over all aspects of human life including perception and understanding.

questions.question: Proverbs 20:13 warns against loving sleep lest poverty come. How is this admonition related to the cultural values of ancient Israel?
options: It reflects the value of diligence and hard work
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects the value of diligence and hard work
questions.explanation: In ancient Israelite culture, diligence was highly prized as essential for survival and prosperity, as Proverbs 20:13 warns that love of sleep leads to want and poverty.

questions.question: Proverbs 20:17 states, 'Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.' What literary device is used here to illustrate consequences?
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor
questions.explanation: The sweetness of deceitful bread contrasted with the gravel-filled mouth metaphorically represents initial pleasure followed by harsh consequences, as per Proverbs 20:17.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 20:18, what is essential for establishing every purpose and making war successfully?
questions.correctAnswer: Good counsel
questions.explanation: The verse highlights that success in plans and warfare depends on wise counsel, reflecting the value of strategic advice in ancient warfare and decision-making.

questions.question: In Proverbs 20:22, the instruction is to not seek personal vengeance but to wait on the LORD. How does this align with teachings in the New Testament?
options: It supports Jesus' teaching of turning the other cheek
It is unrelated to the New Testament
questions.correctAnswer: It supports Jesus' teaching of turning the other cheek
questions.explanation: This Old Testament wisdom aligns with Jesus' New Testament teaching in Matthew 5:39 about refraining from retaliation and leaving vengeance to God.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 20:27 describes the spirit of man as a candle of the LORD, illuminating the inward parts, which foreshadows New Testament themes of inner spiritual illumination.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:27 metaphorically presents the human spirit as a divine lamp, a concept echoed in the New Testament where inner spiritual insight is illuminated by God’s Spirit.

questions.question: Proverbs 20:26 speaks of a wise king who scatters the wicked and brings the wheel over them. What might the 'wheel' symbolize in the ancient Near Eastern judicial context?
options: A symbol of justice and divine punishment
questions.correctAnswer: A symbol of justice and divine punishment
questions.explanation: The wheel likely symbolizes a device of justice or execution, reflecting the king’s authority to punish the wicked, consistent with ancient Near Eastern royal justice practices.

questions.question: Which parallelism type is evident in Proverbs 20:3, 'It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling'?
questions.correctAnswer: Antithetic parallelism
questions.explanation: This verse presents contrasting ideas: honor through ceasing strife versus foolish meddling, typifying antithetic parallelism common in Hebrew poetry.

questions.question: Proverbs 20:29 praises the glory of young men and the beauty of old men. How does this reflect the cultural attitudes toward age in ancient Israel?
options: Old age was honored for wisdom
Both youth and old age had valued attributes
questions.correctAnswer: Both youth and old age had valued attributes
questions.explanation: The verse acknowledges the strength of youth and the honor of gray hair, showing a balanced respect for different life stages in Israelite culture.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Proverbs 20:9: 'Who can say, I have made my heart ______, I am pure from my sin?'
questions.correctAnswer: clean
questions.explanation: The verse questions human claims to moral purity, emphasizing that no one can fully claim a clean heart free from sin.

questions.question: Proverbs 20:19 warns against associating with a talebearer. How does this warning relate to the social fabric in ancient Israelite communities?
questions.correctAnswer: Talebearers disrupted social harmony
questions.explanation: Talebearers spread secrets and discord, threatening the unity and trust essential for the cohesion of ancient Israelite society.

theological.title: Proverbs Chapter 20 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Proverbs Chapter 20 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 20:1, what is the characteristic behavior of wine and strong drink, and what is the consequence for those deceived by them?
options: Wine is a mocker and strong drink is raging; those deceived are not wise
Wine is a blessing and strong drink is comforting; those deceived are wise
Wine is harmless and strong drink is peaceful; those deceived are innocent
Wine is a teacher and strong drink is a guide; those deceived are enlightened
questions.correctAnswer: Wine is a mocker and strong drink is raging; those deceived are not wise
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:1 states that wine mocks and strong drink rages, warning that those deceived by them lack wisdom. This aligns with Ephesians 5:18 which warns against drunkenness, and Galatians 5:21 which lists drunkenness as a work of the flesh. Isaiah 5:11-12 also condemns excessive drinking, while 1 Peter 5:8 calls believers to be sober and vigilant.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 20:2 compare the fear of a king to, and what is the spiritual consequence of provoking his anger?
options: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion; provoking him sins against one's own soul
The fear of a king is like a gentle breeze; provoking him brings peace
The fear of a king is like a still pond; provoking him is harmless
The fear of a king is like a shining star; provoking him leads to glory
questions.correctAnswer: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion; provoking him sins against one's own soul
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:2 likens the king's fear to a lion's roar, emphasizing the danger of provoking his anger which harms one's soul. This reflects Romans 13:1-4 where authorities bear the sword to punish evildoers, and Psalm 2:10-12 which warns against rebellion. Ecclesiastes 8:2 also speaks of the power of a king's anger and the wisdom of fearing him.

questions.question: What virtue is described in Proverbs 20:3 as an honor for a man, contrasted with the behavior of a fool?
options: Ceasing from strife is an honor; fools meddle
Gaining wealth is an honor; fools give away
Speaking boldly is an honor; fools remain silent
Seeking knowledge is an honor; fools ignore it
questions.correctAnswer: Ceasing from strife is an honor; fools meddle
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:3 states that ceasing from strife is honorable, while fools are meddlesome. This principle is echoed in James 3:17 which associates wisdom with peace, and Romans 12:18 which urges believers to live peaceably. Matthew 5:9 blesses peacemakers, contrasting with Proverbs 18:6 which warns about foolish quarrels.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 20:4 teaches that the sluggard will not plow due to the cold, therefore he will ______ in harvest.
questions.correctAnswer: beg
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:4 explains that laziness leads to lack during harvest, as the sluggard refuses to work. This teaches the principle of diligent labor found in 2 Thessalonians 3:10, and Colossians 3:23. Proverbs 10:4 also contrasts diligence with poverty, while Ecclesiastes 11:6 encourages timely labor for future gain.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 20:5, what is the nature of counsel in the heart of man, and who can draw it out?
options: Counsel is like deep water; a man of understanding can draw it out
Counsel is like a shallow stream; a fool can draw it out
Counsel is like a desert; no one can draw it out
Counsel is like a bright light; a child can draw it out
questions.correctAnswer: Counsel is like deep water; a man of understanding can draw it out
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:5 states that wise understanding is needed to extract deep counsel. This echoes James 1:5 encouraging believers to seek wisdom, Proverbs 2:6 identifying God as the source of wisdom, and Colossians 2:3 which speaks of hidden treasures of wisdom in Christ. Psalm 119:130 also highlights the enlightening power of God's words.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 20:6 say about the commonness of proclaiming goodness and the rarity of faithful men?
options: Most men proclaim their own goodness, but a faithful man is rare
Most men deny their goodness, but a faithful man is common
Most men are faithful, but proclaiming goodness is rare
Most men are unfaithful, and proclaiming goodness is rare
questions.correctAnswer: Most men proclaim their own goodness, but a faithful man is rare
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:6 points out human pride in self-praise contrasted with the scarcity of true faithfulness. This aligns with Jeremiah 17:9 on the deceitfulness of the heart, Galatians 6:4 encouraging honest self-examination, and Matthew 7:15-20 which warns to recognize true fruits. Psalm 101:6 shows the king’s commitment to faithfulness.

questions.question: Which statement best describes the just man according to Proverbs 20:7?
options: The just man walks in integrity and his children are blessed after him
The just man accumulates wealth and his children are neglected
The just man hides his righteousness and his children suffer
The just man judges harshly and his children rebel
questions.correctAnswer: The just man walks in integrity and his children are blessed after him
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:7 emphasizes the blessing that comes from walking in integrity, extending to one's children. This reflects Psalm 112:1-2 linking righteousness with lasting blessing, Deuteronomy 5:10 on God's covenant faithfulness to descendants, and 2 Timothy 1:5 honoring sincere faith passed through generations. Proverbs 11:5 also connects righteousness with stability.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 20:8 say about a king who sits on the throne of judgment?
options: He scatters away all evil with his eyes
He shows favor to the rich
He listens only to his advisors
questions.correctAnswer: He scatters away all evil with his eyes
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:8 describes the king’s righteous gaze as a deterrent to evil, symbolizing just rule. This corresponds with Psalm 72:1-4 about kingly justice, Romans 13:4 on rulers as God's servants for good, Isaiah 11:4 about a righteous judge, and Revelation 20:12 where judgment is depicted. Such authority reflects God's sovereign justice (Psalm 97:2).

questions.question: What rhetorical question does Proverbs 20:9 ask regarding human purity?
options: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
Who can say, I have never sinned?
Who can say, I am wise beyond all others?
Who can say, I am stronger than my enemies?
questions.correctAnswer: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:9 questions human claims to sinless purity, underscoring universal human sinfulness as taught in Romans 3:23, Ecclesiastes 7:20, 1 John 1:8 admitting sin, and Psalm 51:5 acknowledging original sin. This humility points toward the need for divine forgiveness (Isaiah 1:18).

questions.question: What is declared an abomination to the LORD in Proverbs 20:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Diverse weights and diverse measures
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:10 condemns dishonest measures as abominations, reflecting God's call for justice in Leviticus 19:35-36, Deuteronomy 25:13-16, Amos 8:5, and Micah 6:11. Proverbs 11:1 also states that the LORD hates false scales, emphasizing integrity in commerce as a moral imperative.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 20:12, who made the hearing ear and the seeing eye?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:12 attributes human faculties of hearing and seeing to the LORD, highlighting God's sovereignty over human senses. This is consistent with Psalm 94:9, Isaiah 44:24 where God forms all things, John 1:3 affirming all creation through Christ, and Colossians 1:16-17 declaring Christ’s sustaining power over all.

questions.question: What warning does Proverbs 20:13 give about loving sleep?
options: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty
Love sleep, for it restores the soul
Love sleep, and you will be wise
Love not sleep, for it causes sickness
questions.correctAnswer: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:13 warns that excessive sleep leads to poverty, emphasizing diligence. This principle is echoed in Proverbs 6:10-11, Ecclesiastes 10:18 on laziness causing ruin, 2 Thessalonians 3:10 on working to eat, and Proverbs 13:4 contrasting the diligent and the slothful.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 20:15 says, 'There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but ______ are a precious jewel.'
questions.correctAnswer: the lips of knowledge
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:15 values knowledge expressed by speech above material wealth, highlighting the treasure of wisdom. This aligns with Proverbs 3:13-15, Job 28:18, Ecclesiastes 7:12 about wisdom’s value, and James 3:17 describing wisdom from above.

questions.question: What advice does Proverbs 20:18 give about establishing a purpose?
options: Every purpose is established by counsel and good advice
Every purpose is established by strength and might
Every purpose is established by chance and luck
Every purpose is established by haste and pride
questions.correctAnswer: Every purpose is established by counsel and good advice
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:18 teaches the importance of wise counsel in planning, echoed in Proverbs 15:22, Proverbs 11:14, Ecclesiastes 4:13, and James 1:5 which encourage seeking wisdom and advice before action.

questions.question: What consequence does Proverbs 20:20 describe for one who curses his father or mother?
options: His lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness
He shall be blessed with long life
questions.correctAnswer: His lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness
questions.explanation: Proverbs 20:20 warns that cursing parents leads to spiritual condemnation symbolized by a lamp extinguished. This is consistent with Exodus 21:17, Ephesians 6:2-3 emphasizing honoring parents, Matthew 15:4-6 on commandments, and Colossians 3:20.
